title: How to Make Lip Gloss with Petroleum Jelly

steps.title: Assemble a double-boiler.
steps.content: Assemble a double-boiler. Fill a medium-sized bowl with 1 to 2 inches (2.54 to 5.08 centimeters) of water, and place a heat-safe bowl on top. The bottom of the bowl should not be touching the water. Try to use a glass bowl. It will help things heat more evenly.

steps.title: Add 2 tablespoons (30 grams) of petroleum jelly, 1 teaspoon (5 grams) of shea butter, and ¼ teaspoon (1.25 milliliters) of coconut oil to the bowl.
steps.content: Add 2 tablespoons (30 grams) of petroleum jelly, 1 teaspoon (5 grams) of shea butter, and ¼ teaspoon (1.25 milliliters) of coconut oil to the bowl. The shea butter and coconut oil will moisturize your lips, while the petroleum jelly will hold everything together. If you can't find coconut oil, try some jojoba oil or almond oil instead. Both are very moisturizing. If you can't find or don't like shea butter, try cocoa butter or coconut butter instead. Both will give the lip gloss a subtle taste.

steps.title: Melt the petroleum jelly, butter, and oil over medium heat.
steps.content: Melt the petroleum jelly, butter, and oil over medium heat. Stir the ingredients often so that they melt evenly. The texture should be smooth, and there should be no lumps or clumps.

steps.title: Take the melted mixture off heat, and stir in some color or flavor, if desired.
steps.content: Take the melted mixture off heat, and stir in some color or flavor, if desired. Lift the bowl off of the saucepan and set it down onto a stable, heat-resistant surface. For extra flavor, stir in 3 to 5 drops of your favorite extract. For extra color, stir in some loose eyeshadow or powdered blush. You can also use some powdered drink mix to give you both color and flavor.

steps.title: Pour the mixture quickly into a clean, empty container.
steps.content: Pour the mixture quickly into a clean, empty container. You can use an empty lip balm container or even a clean contact lens case. You can also use small containers meant for storing excess paint; you can find them in the painting section of an arts and crafts store.

steps.title: Let the lip balm cool before you use it.
steps.content: Let the lip balm cool before you use it. If you are in a hurry, put it in the fridge for a few hours. As it cools, it will become solid again. You can apply it with your finger or a cotton swab.

steps.title: Put 2 tablespoons (30 grams) of petroleum jelly into a small, microwave-safe bowl.
steps.content: Put 2 tablespoons (30 grams) of petroleum jelly into a small, microwave-safe bowl. You will need to melt the lip gloss before you pour it into its final container.

steps.title: Cut off a small piece of lipstick, and add it to the bowl.
steps.content: Cut off a small piece of lipstick, and add it to the bowl. The more lipstick you use, the more opaque your lip gloss will be. For a shimmery lip gloss, use a lipstick that already has some sparkle to it.

steps.title: Microwave for 30 seconds, until melted.
steps.content: Microwave for 30 seconds, until melted. This will help the lip stick mix into the petroleum jelly better.

steps.title: Stir the mixture with a spoon until it is smooth.
steps.content: Stir the mixture with a spoon until it is smooth. The mixture should be smooth, and without any lumps. If it is not smooth after you stir it, microwave it for another 30 seconds and stir again.

steps.title: Add a few drops of almond oil and 3 to 5 drops of flavoring.
steps.content: Add a few drops of almond oil and 3 to 5 drops of flavoring. [1] X Research source The almond oil will leave your lips supple, and the flavoring will give it a nicer taste. You can use extract or candy-making flavoring. Use no more than ¼ teaspoon (1.25 milliliters) of almond oil, or your lip gloss may start to separate. [2] X Research source You can also use some essential oil instead of the flavoring. Essential oil is very potent. Start with one drop, stir, then add more if needed.

steps.title: Stir with a spoon until everything is smooth and evenly mixed together.
steps.content: Stir with a spoon until everything is smooth and evenly mixed together. There should be no lumps, clumps, streaks, or swirls.

steps.title: Pour the mixture to a small container.
steps.content: Pour the mixture to a small container. Once you get the color you like, pour the mixture into a small container. Use a mini spatula, butter knife, or spoon to help guide it into the container, if needed. You can find small containers in the paint section of an art store. You can also use clean and empty lip gloss containers, contact lens cases, and pill boxes as well.

steps.title: Wait for the mixture to harden before you use it.
steps.content: Wait for the mixture to harden before you use it. If you are in a rush, put it into the fridge for a few hours. As the lip gloss cools, it will become more solid. You can apply it using your finger or a cotton swab.

steps.title: Place 2 tablespoons (30 grams) of petroleum jelly into a small, microwave-safe bowl.
steps.content: Place 2 tablespoons (30 grams) of petroleum jelly into a small, microwave-safe bowl. This will be enough for one color/flavor. If you'd like to make more colors or flavors, you will need to make separate batches.

steps.title: Put the bowl into the microwave, heat it for 30 seconds, then stir it with a spoon.
steps.content: Put the bowl into the microwave, heat it for 30 seconds, then stir it with a spoon. [3] X Research source The petroleum jelly should be clear and smooth, with no lumps or clumps. If the petroleum jelly is not fully-melted, microwave it for another 15 to 30 seconds, and stir it again. Keep microwaving and stirring the petroleum jelly until it is completely melted. [4] X Research source

steps.title: Stir in up to 1 packet/envelope of drink mix.
steps.content: Stir in up to 1 packet/envelope of drink mix. The more mix you use, the darker color you will get. The flavor will also be stronger. You can use any type of mix you like, but berry-flavored ones will give you the typical pink color. You can also try mixing different drinks together to create a "fruit punch" type flavor. Be mindful of the colors, however.

steps.title: Pour the mixture into a clean, small, empty container.
steps.content: Pour the mixture into a clean, small, empty container. You can find empty containers in the paint section of an art store; they are used for storing extra paint, and make great lip gloss containers. You can also use empty lip gloss containers, clean contact lens cases, and pill boxes as well.

steps.title: Let the mixture cool before you use it.
steps.content: Let the mixture cool before you use it. If you are in a hurry, you can put it into the fridge for a few hours. As it cools, it will harden and become more solid. You can apply it using your finger or a cotton swab.

steps.title: Add 2 tablespoons (30 grams) of petroleum jelly into a small bowl.
steps.content: Add 2 tablespoons (30 grams) of petroleum jelly into a small bowl. You will be mixing the lip gloss in this, and then transferring it into another container later.

steps.title: Find some powdered eyeshadow or blush.
steps.content: Find some powdered eyeshadow or blush. If you can't find any, scrape some eyeshadow into a plastic. You can use a spoon, fork, or toothpick to get it out. Crush it into a fine powder using a spoon or fork. Make sure that there are no clumps or chunks, or your lip gloss will turn out grainy. For a shimmery lip gloss, use an eyeshadow or blush that already has some sparkle to it.

steps.title: Stir the eyeshadow into the petroleum jelly.
steps.content: Stir the eyeshadow into the petroleum jelly. Use something thin, like a chopstick or toothpick. Keep stirring until everything is evenly combined. There should be no streaks, swirls, chunks, or clumps.

steps.title: Transfer the mixture to a small container.
steps.content: Transfer the mixture to a small container. Once you get the color and texture you like, scoop the mixture into a small container. Use a mini spatula, butter knife, or spoon to help you. You can find small containers in the paint section of an art store. They are meant for storing excess paint, but they make great lip gloss containers. You can also use empty lip gloss containers, clean contact lens cases, and pill boxes as well.

steps.title: Let the lip gloss harden, then use it whenever you want a touch of color or sparkle on your lips.
steps.content: Let the lip gloss harden, then use it whenever you want a touch of color or sparkle on your lips. If you are in a rush, leave it in the fridge for a few hours until it hardens. You can apply it using your finger or a cotton swab.
